div.p: I’ll never forget my tutor, Tony Williams, an ex-submariner who said to me, I’ll never forget this as long as I live...
"You know all that rubbish they taught you at training school? Forget it, I’ll show you how to become a copper"
and that’s what happened because you need the law, you need to know, you need to have that knowledge base but you need
the experience to deal with things and deal with people because people are different and fly off the handle all the time and
dealing with confrontation and we never sort of dealt with that in the training school environment and what have you and that was the thing
learning how to deal with confrontation...
